Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How did everything go since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I actually went hiking on Saturday, and it was really nice to be outdoors.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel to get back to something you enjoy?
It felt great! I forgot how much I love being in nature. It was refreshing.
I’m so glad you had that experience. Did you notice any changes in your mood afterward?
Yeah, I felt a lot lighter and more relaxed.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like getting outside was beneficial for you. Did you manage to talk to your partner about how you’ve been feeling?
I did! It was a little awkward at first, but they were really supportive.
That’s great to hear! Opening up can be tough, but it sounds like it strengthened your connection.
Yeah, I felt a weight lift off my shoulders.
That’s a significant step forward. How have you been feeling since then?
I still have my moments, but I think being honest with them has helped a lot.
Honesty can be very freeing. Have you been able to keep up with journaling or meditation?
I started journaling again, but I haven’t tried meditation yet.
That’s okay! Journaling is a great start. What have you been writing about?
Mostly my feelings about work and my mom. It helps to get it out on paper.
That’s a healthy way to process your emotions. How do you feel after writing?
I feel a bit lighter, like I’m not holding everything in.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re finding some effective outlets for your emotions.
Yeah, I think so.
Have you noticed any changes in your eating habits since we last spoke?
I’m trying to be more mindful about what I eat. I still struggle, but I’m working on it.
That’s a positive approach. Mindfulness can help you make healthier choices.
I’ve been trying to listen to my body more.
That’s a great practice! It can be helpful to check in with yourself before eating. What does your body really need?
I think I’m getting better at it.
Excellent! You’re making progress. How about your sleep? Have you tried the guided meditation we discussed?
I did, and it actually helped me fall asleep faster.
That’s fantastic! Meditation can be a powerful tool for relaxation. How are your sleep patterns overall?
I’m still waking up sometimes, but it’s not as bad as before.
That’s a positive change! It sounds like you’re developing some effective strategies.
I think so. I just need to keep at it.
Consistency is key. Is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to discuss?
I’ve been thinking about my mom a lot lately. Some days are harder than others.
Grief can be a long and winding journey. How are you coping with those harder days?
I just let myself feel it, but I try to distract myself with other things too.
That’s a healthy way to approach your grief. Allowing yourself to feel while also finding distractions can create a balance.
Yeah, it helps to have those moments of distraction.
Have you considered creating a small ritual to honor her memory?
I haven’t thought about that. What do you mean?
It could be something simple, like lighting a candle or writing her a letter. It can be a way to connect with your feelings about her.
I like that idea. I might try writing her a letter.
That sounds like a meaningful way to express your feelings. Would you like to set a time to do that?
I think I’ll do it this weekend.
That’s a great plan. I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Remember, you’re not alone in this journey. I’m here for you.
I know, and it really helps.
Let’s continue to build on the progress you’ve made. I’ll see you next time!
Bye, Ellie!
